intro: Lyonsia induplicata, commonly known as the southern greenbark, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, green bark and heart-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Lyonsia induplicata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
